p: On November 30, 2013, the first case of human infection with H10N8 avian influenza virus was discovered in Nanchang City, Chinaâ€™s Jiangxi Province.[ 8] The patient was a 73-year-old woman, who was diagnosed with severe pneumonia accompanied by high blood pressure, heart disease, myasthenia gravis and other underlying diseases, with a low immunity level. A 55-year-old woman in Jiangxi Province was reported as the second human case of H10N8. Chinese CDC found that the risk of human infection and transmission of H10N8 avian influenza virus through personal contact was low.
